meaning_str.bing:
v. 行为；表现；举止；规矩
网络. 运转；守规矩；举止端正

行为；表现；举止得体；有礼貌；守规矩；运作；起反应；起作用

1.en: I apologize for the tone I used, but not seeing any response from her I did not know how to behave.
1.cn: 很抱歉我的口气不好，但是因为我没有看到她的回复，所以不知道如何操作。

2.en: Even if the alternative vote is not the official system, voters will tend to behave as if it were.
2.cn: 即使AV制不是正式的投票制度，选民的投票模式也往往符合AV制的安排。

3.en: Instead of using cells derived from embryos, researchers found a way to make adult cells behave as though they were embryonic.
3.cn: 科学家们不在使用来源于胚胎的细胞，而是发现了一种新方法，可使成熟细胞呈现出胚胎细胞的特征。

0.en: The same thing I've been doing for three days. Trying to figure out why electrons behave as if they have no mass when traveling through a graphene sheet.
0.cn: 做我这三天一直在做的工作，想要弄明白为什么电子在穿过石墨烯时会表现得像是没有质量一样。

1.en: They still behave a bit like bacteria.
1.cn: 它们的习性依然与细菌有些许相似之处。

2.en: Okay. What if I got him to apologize and promise to behave?
2.cn: 成吧，要是我能让他道歉并且保证他乖呢？

3.en: Joey, come on! Please, please? Let me come. I will behave. I promise.
3.cn: 乔伊，别这样！拜托啦，让我参加，我会克制自己，我保证。

4.en: It makes us value it more and this excitement cause us many times to behave and get it.
4.cn: 这使得物品更有价值，此模式我们经历过很多，消费者也都愿意购买。

5.en: Of course. No, I'm much more concerned about you. I know how you gals behave when the men are away.
5.cn: 当然啦。其实我更担心的是你。我知道男人不在时你们女人都是什么德行。

6.en: Using our impressions as guides, we can accurately predict how people are going to behave in the future.
6.cn: 我们用印象做为指引能够准确的预测这些人在未来会有什么样的举止。

7.en: As long as the White House continues to behave this way, any future bilateral trade talks will be impossible.
7.cn: 如果白宫还要继续如此行事，那么将来任何的双边对话都是不可能的。

8.en: This dark energy doesn't behave like any other substance we know at all and acts more like anti-gravity force.
8.cn: 这种暗能量的性质与我们所熟知的其他物质完全不同它更像是反重力。

9.en: Who said I am okay with this? What am I supposed to do, make a scene? Behave like some pathetic, scorned wife? No.
9.cn: 谁说我不介意了？那我该怎么做？大闹一场？搞得自己像个可怜的怨妇？我才不要。

10.en: I will behave. Please, Please, please. Okay, fine. you can come. But don't tell anybody else. It's up on the roof at 8.
10.cn: 我会克制自己，拜托。好啦，你可以参加。但是不要告诉其他人，八点钟在屋顶上面。

11.en: Thank you. Now behave yourself and eat your dinner. Maybe later, if you're lucky, you get to sleep with a college girl.
11.cn: 谢谢，现在给我乖乖地吃饭，晚点，运气好的话，你或许可以跟一个大学生上床哟。

12.en: That is enough. Is this how you think the countries of the world behave? Don't they? Of course not. Sorry, Madame Gazelle.
12.cn: 好了，都别再吵了。你们觉得全世界的国家会像你们这样吵吵闹闹吗？不会吗？他们当然不会。对不起，羚羊夫人。

13.en: And that for me is again the promise of behavior economic. It's to say let's kind of figure out people don't behave perfectly.
13.cn: 这是行为经济学的承诺，它认为人无完人。

14.en: The new world. People who lived their whole lives in a certain place travelled to a new land of new feelings and new opportunities, having no idea how to behave in this brand new society.
14.cn: 新世界。一辈子都生活在某个固定地方的人来到一片新的大地上，充满新的感觉和新的机遇，完全不知道在这全新的社会中该怎样。
